column4: Hi everyone, I am trying to figure out how to use a 1440*900 resolution with a GeForce 4 TI 4200, it works under Windows but the max I can get under Ubuntu is 1152*864
edit xorg.conf
is there a tutorial on how to do that somewhere ? I'm pretty new with command line :s
type this in terminal sudo gedit /etc/X11/sorg.conf
What do I need to change in xorg.conf to allow 1440*900 ?
do u see any resolutions in this file?
I do see a lot of resolutions, but I can't find a way to specify which one to allow or to disallow
copy paste ur file into pastebin.ca
http://pastebin.ca/749934
what resolution u want?
1440*900, native resolution for my LCD
what resolution u have now? Also goto System - Prefernces - Screen Resolution and tell me if u see an option for the resolution u want
Already done, I can't select it, I am currently in 1152*864
In fact, 1152*864 is the highest resolution I can see
make a copy of ur current xorg.conf file
Already donbe
as andycr suggested change 1400x1400 to 1400x900 for all
& andycr: Thnx v.much, I'll try that out, but is there a reason why I don't see 1280x1024 nor 1280x960 too ?
depends on ur monitor/LCD conifg
what inch?
19" Samsung SyncMaster 940BW
brb, I'll try the modifications to xorg.conf
grats
